Display in your browser
[https://todoist.doist-emails.com/en/emails/todoist/cms/TDMonthly0226T?%3D%3D&s=EnLkfHusO59QYzswAsZ9OhznXHfwiVj13OeezY5iNsg]

Todoist logo
[https://todoist.doist-emails.com/_next/static/media/todoist-logo.4ba65e41.png]

[https://images.ctfassets.net/5zyjowl7hbbz/3sj5qHQUUWq3f9SjXQc8RF/9958a4d9cf5543e254cf300224cc4a64/Todoist-illustration-new.png?wD0&fm=png]

The Todoist Monthly

â€Š

All thatâ€™s new in the Todoist-verse â€“ February 2026

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

â€Š

Hey there!
[https://res.cloudinary.com/imagist/image/fetch/f_png/c_scale,h_48,w_48/r_max/https://images.ctfassets.net/5zyjowl7hbbz/5TLvxjz8HyhoGtse9WAVau/8f7a80d84cd6348e87310e4444ed9f46/Denise_Avatar.jpeg?_aï¿½TAiZhKZAA0]
Denise here from Todoist ğŸ‘‹.

â€Š

Work arrives in many forms: a 28-page slide deck, a sprawling email thread, or a
saturated whiteboard after a successful brainstorm.

â€Š

This month, weâ€™re focused on helping your team turn those scattered notes and
endless email chains into a clear plan of action.

â€Š

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

â€Š

Scan images and text into tasks

â€Š

Upload a photo, a screenshot, or a wall of text and watch Todoist automatically
(automagically?!) extract the actual tasks.

â€Š

That project brief from a new client? Paste it in. Conference room notes
scribbled on a whiteboard? Take a photo. Todoist does the heavy lifting,
identifying the to-dos and turning them into clean, actionable tasks for your
team.

â€Š

Hereâ€™s
[https://res.cloudinary.com/imagist/image/fetch/f_png/c_scale,h_48,w_48/r_max/https://images.ctfassets.net/5zyjowl7hbbz/618wnv3YZIF9KVFH9JoZ0C/80d4d8e196454289dbb21459c45e3064/Character_Samuel.png?_aï¿½TAiZhKZAA0]
Samuel with a quick demo:

â€Š
[https://images.ctfassets.net/5zyjowl7hbbz/4iK1r4sODlAozwaWAEt7Cn/bb920ad2c704bcae3c0512100baa22b9/video-thumbnail.png?w00&fm=png]https://www.loom.com/share/11c7a86299684d01a7e2b5140b467e5f?utm_source=todoist&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign 26_02_todoist_monthly_teams

â€Š

Image and text scanning
[https://www.todoist.com/help/articles/capture-tasks-from-text-and-images-cAflh0WKe?utm_source=todoist&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign 26_02_todoist_monthly_teams]
has just been rolled out for testing on web and desktop to Experimentalists on
paid plans. To try it out, enable experimental features in your general settings
â€“ youâ€™ll see new text and image icons in Quick Add, right next to
[https://res.cloudinary.com/imagist/image/fetch/f_png/c_scale,h_48,w_48/r_max/https://images.ctfassets.net/5zyjowl7hbbz/NzuGByaXXA0DtDRwOCFBm/7ddcf83914f34a2e4acc9cb101787d01/Ramble-web.svg?_aï¿½TAiZhKZAA0]
Ramble.

â€Š

Ramble: Now with sections and smarter context

â€Š

Ramble supports sections now, so you can say â€œAdd quarterly report to the In
Progress sectionâ€ or â€œPut client feedback in the Review sectionâ€ and tasks land
exactly there.

â€Š
[https://images.ctfassets.net/5zyjowl7hbbz/25Qhi3lNxT4yLxjLSLVJI7/cbc203ffd9e265c579b536c37c868a28/Ramble_with_sections_for_teams.png?w00&fm=png]

â€Š

It also picks up context from wherever you start. Open Ramble from the Today
view, and tasks automatically get scheduled for today. Start from a label view,
and they inherit the label. One less thing to specify. ğŸ™Œ

â€Š

Try Ramble â†’
[https://www.todoist.com/ramble?utm_source=todoist&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign 26_02_todoist_monthly_teams]

â€Š

Forward emails straight into Todoist

â€Š

Your inbox is often where work starts (and never ends ğŸ™ƒ) â€“ now you can turn
those emails into Todoist tasks from anywhere. Weâ€™ve brought our email
forwarding feature to mobile, so you can generate a projectâ€™s unique email
address
[https://www.todoist.com/help/articles/forward-emails-to-todoist-JPJ1V339?utm_source=todoist&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign 26_02_todoist_monthly_teams]
directly from your iOS or Android app.

â€Š
[https://images.ctfassets.net/5zyjowl7hbbz/4L4OGMPH8QiBNbZ9dcSMYr/9d177cfa811170236741a3d7c8e8cb79/Email_forwarding_for_teams.png?w00&fm=png]

â€Š

 * Generate addresses on the go: Grab the unique forwarding address from the
   three dots menu in any project or task.

 * Forward in seconds: Send project updates, invoices, or new client requests
   straight to Todoist to keep them from becoming overlooked.

 * Pro-tip: Save your projectâ€™s forwarding address as a contact (like â€œClient
   Projectâ€) for instant, automatic forwarding.

â€Š

[https://todoist.doist-emails.com/_next/static/media/lightbulb-yellow.6590e21e.png]

On paid plans, you can use Email Assist
[https://www.todoist.com/help/articles/forward-emails-to-todoist-JPJ1V339?utm_source=todoist&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign 26_02_todoist_monthly_teams#h_01HM9BWDZA8VZ54SA8S7ANY5V8]
to auto-fill a taskâ€™s title, description, and date directly from the email. Turn
it on when you set up forwarding, so you can skip digging through those lengthy
client threads.

â€Š

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

â€Š

ğŸ’¬ Quick question: How does your team communicate at work? Your responses help
us understand what teams actually need (custom emojis anyone?). Weâ€™d love your
input â€“ take our quick survey
[https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSePX1CFsaOwqNI32NfgMO3mpuPVLYHE61F3LJrNOJPOnz9HHw/viewform?utm_source=todoist&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign 26_02_todoist_monthly_teams].

â€Š

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

â€Š

When capturing work is this frictionless, your team spends less time chasing
down information and more time actually making progress.

â€Š

Hereâ€™s to more focus and fewer â€˜where did I put that?â€™ moments.

â€Š


See you in March!

â€Š

Productively,

INSTRUCTIONS: Evaluate this email. If important (login codes, billing, payments, action required, replies to Bill, package tracking), DM Bill using: message action=send channel=discord target=user:191633014441115648 message="brief summary". If not important (marketing, newsletters, spam, test emails from himself, Google security alerts about new sign-ins/devices, GitHub PR comments/reviews/CI notifications), reply NO_REPLY. SKIP all Google Security Alert emails. SKIP all GitHub notification emails about PR comments, reviews, code review requests, CI/CD status, and issue comments. Auto-track any package tracking numbers with 17TRACK.

Return your summary as plain text; it will be delivered automatically. If the task explicitly calls for messaging a specific external recipient, note who/where it should go instead of sending it yourself.
